name: outbound-rules
description: Protect against XSS by restricting access to outbound resources if a page defines a rule list

scripts.rollup: npm run compile && rollup build/js/background.js > build/background.js
scripts.build-base: npm run rollup && mkdir -p plugin && cp build/background.js assets/logo.png LICENSE AUTHORS README.md plugin/
scripts.build-chrome: npm run build-base && cp assets/manifest-chrome.json plugin/manifest.json
scripts.build-firefox: npm run build-base && cp assets/manifest-firefox.json plugin/manifest.json
scripts.release-chrome: npm run build-chrome && (cd plugin/ ; ver=$(jq -r .version < manifest.json) && zip -r ../outbound-rules-$ver.crx .)
scripts.release-firefox: npm run build-firefox && (cd plugin/ ; ver=$(jq -r .version < manifest.json) && zip -r ../outbound-rules-$ver.xpi .)
scripts.compile-integration-tests: tsc --outDir build/integration-tests -m commonjs -t ES2015 src/integration-tests/ts/*.ts && cp src/integration-tests/resources/* build/integration-tests
scripts.integration-tests: npm run compile-integration-tests && npm run release-chrome && npm run integration-tests-bare
scripts.test: npm run compile && npm run unit-tests-bare && npm run integration-tests
